title: Scotland to become highest taxed part of UK after historic Holyrood vote
text: GETTY Holyrood passed a historic vote which will raise taxes to the highest levels in the UK Now is not the time to be giving away a substantial tax cut as the Tories would Derek Mackay, Finance secretary Ahead of that, MSPs were today asked to approve the "Scottish rate resolution" for 2017/18, setting the rates and bands for income tax. Finance Secretary Derek Mackay had originally proposed increasing the higher rate threshold for income tax in line with inflation. But he agreed to freeze the Â£43,000 threshold entirely as part of his deal with the Scottish Greens. GETTY The Scottish budget is expected to pass its final hurdle on Thursday Scottish Tory finance spokesman Murdo Fraser warned the move "will hurt" Scotland's economy and public finances in the long run. Official figures show unemployment in Scotland is increasing as it falls across the UK as a whole. The UK economy also grew by 4 per cent in the year to September 2016, but Scotland recorded only 0.2 per cent growth. GETTY MSPs were asked to support the 'Scottish rate resolution' Defending the plans Mr Mackay said: "Now is not the time to be giving away a substantial tax cut as the Tories would. "So, by asking those higher-earning Scots to forgo a tax cut, additional revenue will be raised to support our vital public services." Related articles
